title: To the non techinical
comment: If you are having trouble with Super su try deleting super su and install the regular su. Then install super su. Super should ask for user rights from su and take over all grant user rights for this function. It worked for me and I have no problems other than the shell activation

title: won't install...
comment: Will not work with SuperSu and the binary fails on Superuser... would love to install on phone...run Debian on everything else....any work arounds?
no supersu support
No SuperSU

title: Good but not great! **edited: workaround for supersu latest issue
comment: It's working fine after I sort some prob with ssh arguments with other apps. Installation was a breeze if nothing get interfered with. Found that it's easily get interrupted when another root app was mounted and lil' debi stop function will fail. EDITED: Anyone having problems using SuperSU with Lil' Debi needs to install CWM's superuser as a placebo. Uncheck "mount namespace separation" on SuperSU's settings and reboot. Run lil' debi and allow root access with SuperSU. Freeze (disable) superuser app then.

title: No SuperSU support
comment: I rooted a Nexus 5 with Chainfire's auto-root (=> SuperSU). The app wants to install Superuser which fails with 'Unknown error code during application install: "-505"'.

title: No SuperSu support
comment: Ugh

title: Doesn't work with SuperSU
comment: Samsung Galaxy S5, rooted with Odin and the CF-AUTO-ROOT file that installs SuperSU. I installed the Superuser app by ClockworkMod this app was asking for and it wouldn't update it's binary. Tried to disable SuperSU so Superuser might work, but ended up removing both apps. I had to break out Odin again to add it back, now I'm rooted again. I've never had any issues with other apps asking for root permissions and SuperSU giving it to them.  Sounds like a great project though. I'd like to be able to install tools for my phone using apt-get

title: Please support SuperSU!
comment: Otherwise looks like a great project

title: Does it work with SuperSU?
comment: Asks for super user access,  I'm rooted with Chainfire's super su but the app doesn't recognise that.

title: solved
comment: Tnx for your reply, the problem on that phone (Galaxy note 8) did not solved but I installed the package on my Huawei G700 and it works good, just that is not good to force installing clockwork's superuser in your new update, maybe we use other supersu things...
Sorry for your trouble. We need more information to understand what exactly is happening. Could you post this to our issue tracker? https://github.com/guardianproject/lildebi/issues/new

title: Cool...!
comment: Another great app. by guardian!
Right on

title: I think id like it...
comment: Uf I had the password to ssh. I try to ssh into localhost and it asks for password. Could you give it to me? I tried password/Password.. No joy. Thanks in advance

There is no default password, so you can't ssh in with a password unless you set one.  The easiest way to do that is by installing Android Terminal Emulator, or using `adb shell` from your desktop machine.

title: socket permission error
comment: after installation, some services still can't start (:DNS couldn't create socket) even after add a "aid_inet" group!

The Android INTERNET permission (that aid_inet UNIX group) is the only thing that I know of that would prevent network services from working.  But perhaps they've added some new pain points in KitKat in the networking as well.

title: sam
comment: could not get to work on nexus 7 2013, rooted with unlocked bootloader. tried both wheezy and jessie, soft- and hard-float. tried increasing the image size too. it either hangs / crashes during installation, or i get a 'chroot can't execute /data/data***/complete-debian-setup.sh.  On a 'successful' install i get a return error of 255 starting the device is busy and cannot mount. On a unsuccessful install, i get an error: '/system/bin/e2fsck attempt to read block from filesystem resulted in short read. Could this be a zero-length partition? while trying to open /sdcard/debian.img'. Would love to get this working...

Can you post your install log to a bug report?  You can get it via the menu.  Here is the issue tracker: https://github.com/guardianproject/lildebi/issues

Or you can email it to me directly if you want to keep it private: support@guardianproject.info

comment: Note 2 running 4.4.2 kk

title: Cannot install build-essentials ldconfig is missing
comment: libpam-modules will not install because ldconfig is missing also I cannot install build-essential because of unmet dependencies (apt-get install -f does not work either). So far this chroot is limited in use.

title: Unbelievable!
comment: Great app, nice set of features, and it does it's job great! Can't wait to see what else is in stock! Outstanding work!

title: Not Working
comment: Not working on the TF300T say's installing, boot into Debian, but doesn't install anything, am using 4.4-KK not 4.3-JB but regressing the ROM has the same problem, still doesn't like the Tablet. I hear Android is Linux again thanks to the 3.3 Kernel update, so I guess it's only a matter of time before we'll see this Native. That's all I & so many other's really want, a way to flash the whole Debian image as a ROM replacing Stock or CM with a Full Debian OS... Guess we've all got to wait, till someone out there does it! Gnome 3 touch.. (drool) CM- Does not need access to SMS on a Tablet? But it's programmed in there anyhow & after reading about Snowdens leaks about how software & hardware is tainted we all know why.. (Google!)

comment: Is there a user forum or help page somewhere?

title: Couldn't get it too work
comment: Stock rooted Nexus 5,  I get this after installing  > losetup /dev/block/loop1 /sdcard/debian.img  root mount for everything Debian mount: mounting /dev/block/loop1 on /debian failed: Device or resource busy Mounting '/debian' failed, returned 255 Starting OpenBSD Secure Shell server: sshd
there is a new update that should fix this problem, v0.4.6

title: Very simple and effective
comment: Ran very well in my ASUS TF300TL. But remember you need root and something like ConnectBot for a command line (use localhost or 127.0.0.1 and port 5900).

title: Runs perfect now.
comment: This last update fixed all of my installation issues, it's now running like a champ! I'm really digging having a full Linux distro in my tablet.
just uploaded an update that hopefully addresses this, please file a bug report if its still a problem

title: Thank you
comment: This is another great product!!

comment: This was an inspirational piece of software when it worked.
just uploading an update with another sdcard fix. it works on my Nexus 7 flo with 4.4.2, let me know if it doesn't work for you.

title: Was a 5/5
comment: Startup script was never fixed it still uses /storage/emulated/0 I'm not sure why they claim to have fixed it above

title: Great Linux env
comment: Works so easily. Up and running with Debian in no time.

title: Wurks so far, but
comment: UI is *very* basic and changing path setting for img file is very cryptic. solid but could use some improvements no help function there either
As of version 0.4.2, you can set the image file location in the preferences.

title: Freezes
comment: So I can't tell if it is just because my phone is getting dated or what. I use a Samsung Galaxy Nexus (toro) with CyanogenMod (latest stable). Installing Debian froze three times and required a battery pull. The fourth time it finished. I pulled up a shell and did a "apt-get update" to which it fetched part then froze. Uninstalled image for now. Let me know if my hardware is just too old. App seems solid enough

title: Fail
comment: Status: no sdcard. My sdcard sure is right there. The app succeeded in deleting my previous debian.img installed via Sven-ola Tueck's debian app so the cry that there's no sdcard can nothing else than be bad coding or meaning description.  Not even a suggestion on how to fix the problem. Missed opportunity and an app clearly targeted at lucky devices.
just uploaded an update to address the problems finding the SD card on 4.3 and 4.4. Please file a bug report if this new update does not fix it for you.

title: Froze
comment: Gonna retry but that's all I've gotten so far. Still swear by the dev. I'm sure it's device related.

title: So awesome
comment: A Debian Sid Chroot on my phone? The awesome just got turned up to 11. I did have  a bit of trouble with some mirrors for some reason. Not sure why.

title: Fails to install
comment: Fails to install with about 5 or 6 "permission denied" errors on my rooted AOSP 4.2.2 Google Edition Samsung Galaxy S4, even though the app gets superuser permissions through superSU every time I click the first install button. And yes, I have busybox installed.
I had problems with SuperSU for a while, then some SuperSU updates fixed my issues. If you are still having issues, please file a bug report, or email support.

title: Exactly what I've been looking for, but small kink
comment: Took me some figuring out. I had to DD the image myself and then it installed fine ;) Now to hunt down for what my password is so I can SSH into this beauty :D
if you look at /etc/shadow, you can see there is no password set by default.  To set a password, log in to Debian in Terminal Emulator, i.e. run /debian/shell, then type 'passwd'

title: Does what it claimes to do perfectly
comment: I am just stunned about how good this is working. There are no problems connecting with an Android terminal or via SSH from a remote PC.  (tested on grouper)

title: Armhf, Sid!
comment: This is the best Linux installer I've tried. Even though it doesn't have the UI bling or distro choices of others, you can use armhf architecture and any Debian release... including testing or unstable! And it lets you know if your device lacks loopback or other requirements before you start. My new go-to Linux! I do miss the three letter "deb" script from Debian Kit, though.
Thanks! Patches welcome! If you submit a patch that implements a clean way to add a script called 'deb', I'll include it.

title: It's easy and simple
comment: This is just great, i installed it on a rooted stock rom for n7100,   Only problem is that the installer crashed multiple time before i could eventually successfully install
If you can still make it crash, please file a bug report and include the install log.  You can get that from the menu.

title: Great app!
comment: Just used it on my tablet to install a complete Python development environment. Works perfectly (if you know what you're doing).

title: Wondeful app
comment: Update: Thanks for adding armhf.  My favorite of the Linux installers for Android. Currently using to run a Minecraft server on my Android TV stick.
thanks! armhf support has been added in 0.4.2, just choose between armel and armhf
good

title: outdated fs support
comment: supports only ext2, my phone sd formatted with ext4 by default.
as of version 0.4.1,  Lil' Debi uses ext4 or ext3 by default, if your phone supports it

title: I love the idea
comment: Works fine for me. 5 stars.
